text: - I can't sleep.
We're just surrounded by storms.
(gasping)
It's the second time in not very long

that I've felt like a bit of
an adventurer, an explorer.

♪ More than meets the eye,
this town is oversupplied, oh ♪

- [Elayna] Riley nearly
knelt on a stonefish.
What, it's like neon pink.

- Look at that.
- Oh man.

- My god.
- What?

- It's ridiculous.
- Oh!

- [Riley] Wow, I haven't
seen anything like that ever.
(gentle acoustic music)
- [Elayna] Last time here on the Vagabond,

you were with us as we
arrived in Turks and Caicos

after a series of unfortunate
events of running aground

and then Rile's falling
down an open hatch.

- All right, I want your
attention with that.

- You're gonna have to learn
how to do that, Elayna.
- [Elayna] As Matthieu would say--
- It is a disaster.

- [Elayna] We managed to
pick up Riley's dad, Tony,

and stepmom, Joanne, from the
airport and family friends

before we set off for
a week long adventure

around the incredible
archipelago of Caicos.
So, dock boat came by this morning

and asked us if we could
move up our morning,
which we knew it was gonna happen.
It said in the book that these guys,

well, they're basically
playing musical chairs,

and they're just moving
from morn to morning
and doing heaps of diving.

So, they came by this morning,
asked us if we could move.
We said no worries.
So, we dropped the morning line.

We're actually just drifting
off out to sea right now,
and we're about to hoist the main

and move to French Key, Riley?
- Yep.
(flute music)
Seline, this looks incredible.
What have you knocked up here?
- This is a vegetarian lasagna.

Vegan lasagna for the vegans
that don't like cheese,

and over here is a pot of
meat for the meat lovers.

So that will have to be
heated up to be eaten with it.
- [Riley] Sounds like a deal--
- We have catering for everybody's taste
here on La Vagabond.
(laughs)

- Well done.
- Thank you.
- [Riley] Well done, it looks so good.

I actually grabbed the
camera and started filming,

which doesn't usually happen.
- What?

You're amazing, Seline.
- Well--
- [Riley] What about me for filming?

- [Seline] Do not say that
until you've eaten it, okay?

- [Riley] I can already tell
that's gonna be amazing.

Have a look at it.
- It looks so good.
- [Riley] Did you get to sleep in yet?

- No.
- Just had a big rest.

- Yeah.
- Feel better?

- Yeah I do, I just needed to
lay down and not do anything.

- That's what the doc said.
- Just feeling a bit tired.

- Just really low, like no
energy, like I can't do anything.

I don't want to pick myself
up, like I just feel dead.
- A bit flat.
♪ My love's as wild as the rose ♪
- [Riley] After a nice steady style,
we dropped anchor in French Key.
♪ In the north country ♪
♪ He clings to me as ♪
(aeroplane engine roars)
Where do you reckon they're headed?
- I don't know, I reckon those boys
over here were a bit suspicious.

They took off a million
mile an hour that way.
I don't know where they've gone.
- [Riley] They've stirred up the birds.
- Yeah, I reckon.
(mellow, folksy music)
- So we've just walked ashore,

and we're gonna go check
out this boat over here,
which has clearly washed up
in maybe a hurricane or something.
(mellow, folksy music)
This is pretty sad, isn't it?
(birds chirping)

They're all prickles.
- They are all prickles.
(birds chirping)
- It's the second time in not very long

that I've felt like a bit of
an adventurer, an explorer.
There's some days on a trip or a holiday,
which can really tie it altogether
and make it a bit special,

and I think that today was
definitely one of those days.

Coming over to this island
surrounded by birds,
finding some cactus

and a washed up boat might
not sound that amazing,
but it's been a good day.

It's the one that I always
hoped to be able to have

when people come to visit, and
we've just nailed it today.
Absolutely pumped.
(mellow, folksy music)
Where'd you find that, dad?

- Just washed up on the
boat, it was what we saw
in the water this morning, it's beautiful.
- [Riley] What else have you found?
- A conch shell, and I'm about to attempt
to pull a Lord of the Flies.
(horn rings)
(horn rings)
(laughs)
(door thumps)
- [Riley] Oh, that lasagna smells nice.

Hello.
- Hello.
- [Riley] What have you been doing?

- Slided out the back of the
boat, and then watched a movie.

- [Riley] You explored
the island earlier, you--
- I did, yeah, swam to shore and back.
Saw a big eagle ray, and then I just yeah,
it's just good to be in the water.

And now I'm being lazy,
I'm watching a movie.
And I'm really hungry.

- [Riley] 'Cause you
can smell that lasagna.

- Mhm, I didn't even film the
end result of the lasagna,
but it's all gone, so that's a good sign.
It was really nice.
Riley's on round, what round are you on?

- Round three.
(Elayna chuckles)

It's half past 12, and
we're anchoring really well.
But I can't sleep anyway.
I've got the anchor alarm on,
but we're just surrounded by storms.

There's like lightning
there and there and there,
and I only need more time to sleep.
It's gone about 25 knots.
This angry storm cloud here,

which is giving us 15
knots against the wind now.

It's crawling up wind,
which is not something

that I've seen before.
- Yeah.
- So I'm thinking it's pretty fierce, so--
- And the air has gone really cold too,
where it was humid this morning.
- Yeah, everyone else is just like,
"Oh yeah, angry storm cloud."

There's that old marina,
which I don't want to go to.

If, like on our first go, in
conditions probably like this,

there's an anchor this side,
there's morn bows that side.

And I just guess we'll pick the
lesser of two evils, Elayna.

And also, the wind capes,
the wind was there,
then it was there, and now it's here,
so I think we're gonna miss both of them
unless it gets worse ahead.
- Really, really weird weather.
So we had to leave French Key.
We didn't have to leave, but we wanted to

because we did know the
wind was picking up.

So that's not really,
it's really not protected.
Whoa, oh my gosh!
Water's come in the front window.
So we're moving from French Key

back to West Caicos where
we started our journey.

We're gonna go to a few
different spots this time.
Check out an abandoned hotel,
few more dive sites, then here.
- Forwards, on your right.

- Yeah.
- And we're all good.

Excellent work, everyone,
double water rations.
(laughs)

- I think we should all
go swimming in the rain.

It's good fun.
- I think we should too.
- Yeah, we're already wet.

So we just took a morn bow
back when we first started

because it's not so bad, we
were gonna go into the marina

for some super protection,
but I think this is better.

At least we can swim here.
- I'm not happy.

- You're not happy?
- I want to take a risk.
(chuckles)
No, no, it's a good call.

Well done, Elayna, well
done, skipper for the day.
- It's not so bad.
(brush scrapes)

I'm feeling about a
million times better today
than I did yesterday.

Yesterday, I just had
no energy whatsoever.

I stayed in bed all day, and
I just couldn't explain why.

Yeah, or how I was feeling,
it was just like, yeah.

I've felt like I couldn't
even lift my body up, so--
(broom brushes)
And today, I'm just full of energy, so...
Yes, I'm going to make the most of it,
and Riley is going to swim today

because his leg's all
better, well, he says.
It's still a few days

until the doctor said
he should go swimming,
but we've all had a look at it and yeah.
We think it's relatively sealed.
I think he should be fine.
Camera roulette.

(speaks in French)
Can I open the curtain?
Just a little bit?
What are you doing?
- Puttin' my wits in my pants.
What does it look like I'm doing?
- [Elayna] Because you get to swimming!
- We're gonna go for a swim,

and in what they tell me
is world class dive sites.
And I haven't been able to swim
because I've had stitches in my leg.

I'm still not supposed
to be swimming, but--

- [Elayna] I reckon it's
okay, we'll just dab it

with Dettol afterwards in
case there's any bacteria.
- That's right.
- [Elayna] All right, I'll leave you--

- I'm sure I'll be fine,
that actually hurt a bit.
(fun, upbeat music)

- [Elayna] You nearly
just knelt on a stonefish.

- Really?
- Yeah, gosh.
So we just got back from our free dive,
and Riley nearly knelt on a stone fish.
(classical music)
It was on the ocean floor

looking under like into,
like a bit of a cave,

and I was looking down,
and I saw something move

in the, it was the exact
same colour as the sea grass.

But I saw something move,
it looked like a rock.
- It is the most elusive fish.

- And I noticed it was a
stonefish 'cause they just look,
they have such a unique look.
They're really fat and like scary looking,
and Riley had no idea.

It was like maybe 30
centimetres away from his knee,

and it actually moved forwards
like to come towards him.

And I grab his weight
belt, and I pulled him up.
And he had no idea what was going on.

Like I just had to get
him off the ocean floor.
But yes, there are stone fish around,
and it would have been absolute mayhem
if he had have just got stung,
so I'm very glad that he didn't.
(hammers)

- [Riley's Dad] Wasn't
any bigger than that.
- I am making this up as I go along.
It's trying to run away.
I'll bet there's a thing
where you like put one drop of Betadine,
and it just jumps out.
(laughs)

- Thoughts?
- I reckon it's really nice.

- Tougher than our bologna,
but edible, very mild flavour.

- Oh yeah.
- How'd you cook it?
- Just in hot oil very quick, very hot.
- [Elayna] Okay.
- We're gonna go into the marina.

There's two routes,
which we need to dodge.
I'm gonna pull up in between-ish them,
and Elayna and dad are going to swim
either side of the channel.

And I'm gonna follow about
40 metres behind them,
pull up and anchor.
We're being extraordinarily cautious.
And it's a hurricane ravaged marina.
I think that you could tie off the...

The recommendation is
to just anchor in there.
(mellow rock music)

- [Elayna] Yeah, I think
you're gonna be fine.
(mellow rock music)
(motor roars)
(raindrops trickle)
The others have gone for a long walk to go
and explore the abandoned hotel,
and they are gonna be drenched right now.
(rain pours)
Oh.

Did that rain wake you up?
- Yeah.
They're gonna be absolutely soaked.
(aluminium foil crinkles)
- Well, it was drizzling with rain

when the boys first came
over here to light a fire

to cook the fish, and then,
Hano came over and said,
"Girls, light the oven to put the fish in
"because we can't get it started."
And then, he comes back and says,

"They got the fire cranking
now," so Hano's just gone back
to get the fish out of the oven,
and we're gonna stick it here on the coals
and cook up the grouper that the boys got
on the rod the other day.
So that should be lovely.

- How's my baby doin'?
- I think he's pretty good.
I don't know if we'd said,
but we had an ultrasound the other day,
and we saw him moving around, him or her.
I think that really made it feel real.
- [Riley] Have you thought much

about how this will impact
sailing and/or YouTubing?
- I think we're gonna have
a lot less free time than we already do

'cause the boats, you
have to manage the boat,

which is a full time job,
so to put a baby into that,
I guess we'll find out.

- [Riley] And then,
schooling's another one people
are probably wondering about.

- I'm excited to
home-school the little one.
That'd be really fun.
I think having the little one on the boat
and travelling to the places that we do,
it's gonna open our eyes to things
that, you know, we probably don't see

because they're not
particularly interesting to us,

you know, like kids get excited
over animals and the ocean

and just hanging out in the
park and playing in the grass
and feeding the ducks, you know?

- Yeah.
- We don't do that anymore.

So I think it'll it just bring
a new level to our lives.

- [Riley] It's been a
while since I've fed ducks.
- Me too (chuckles)

- [Riley] Interesting, I
agree with all of that.
Let's go have a beer by the fire.
- I think we should do that.
- [Riley] Go entertain those boof-heads.

- The air has just gotten
really cold, fingers crossed.
(pretty, calm music)
Sky's amazing!
♪ Yeah ♪
What, it's like neon pink.
Wow.

- Everything out here
is all pink and purple

and weird colours, it's
like when they coat these
up in the sunshine, look at that.

- Oh man.
- My god.

- What?
- Ridiculous.

- Oh!
♪ Sundrenched ♪

- Wow, I haven't
seenanything like that ever.

- Even the sand's pink.
- Yeah.

- [Riley's Dad] Are you just
gonna keep sampling, Riles?
- That's good (chuckles)
(thunder roars)

Next week join us as we
say goodbye to our guests.

- So we just dropped off Tony
and Joanne at the airport.

Unfortunately, it's just
going to be Riley and I
on the boat by ourselves again.
